label.text: Argan Trees
Argan trees grow in the arid regions of Morocco and Algeria. They are cultivated for their oil and are an important food source for goats.

Root fungi help argan trees develop strong root systems. The filaments (threadlike structures) of the fungi grow into the argan tree roots enabling better transfer of materials into the trees. In return, the fungi obtain carbohydrates made by the trees through photosynthesis.
Argan Trees
Researchers are trying to find ways to improve argan tree growth during drought.
They studied the effect of two kinds of root fungi, Glomus sp1 and Glomus sp2, on the growth of argan trees during drought.
Groups of argan trees were grown in soil containing either Glomus sp1 or Glomus sp2.
A control group was grown in soil that did not contain root fungi.
For each group of argan trees, the lengths of the main stems were measured and averaged.
The stem-length data is shown in the graph below.
What word describes the relationship between the fungi and the argan trees?
predatory
symbiotic
harmful
competitive
Are the statements in the table supported by the information in the graph?
Select ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for each statement.
After 90 days, the average length of argan main tree stems grown with Glomus sp1 is longer than that of the control group.
After 30 days, the average length of argan main tree stems grown with Glomus sp2 is longer than that of the control group.
The results show that argan trees grown with Glomus sp1 or Glomus sp2 will grow better in drought conditions than argan trees grown with no fungi.
To improve the growth of argan trees, seedlings should be grown with Glomus sp2 fungi rather than Glomus sp1 fungi.
The researchers collected data on the biomass produced by the argan trees in the study. Biomass is the mass of the living tree apart from its water content.
If insufficient nutrients are available to the trees, they will produce limited amounts of biomass.
Based on the data in the graph above, what is the likely way in which root fungi benefit argan trees?
